Why was it called the Golden Age Of Hollywood?

The Golden Age is so called because of the amount of money the movies produced and the images of the glittering and glamorous movie stars that filled the movie screens.

Who discovered Hollywood? FIND OUT!

Harvey Henderson Wilcox owned a ranch west of the city of Los Angeles,which his wife Daeida named Hollywood, and that they founded together.

Who created the Hollywood sign? Learn Now

The sign was created as a real-estate advertisement. By 1923 Los Angeles publisher Harry Chandles had decided to invest in an upscale real-estate development call Hollywoodland, which capitalized on the growing recognition of Hollywood as a movie industry mecca.
